instructionDialog.heading: OBS Setup Guide for Live Streaming
instructionDialog.description: To start sharing your content with your audience, follow this step-by-step guide to connecting OBS Studio. Just a few steps, and you're ready to go live!

step1.title: üîë Step 1: Download OBS Studio and Generate Server URL and Stream Key
step1.description: To start streaming, you need two key elements: Server URL and Stream Key. Follow these steps:

downloadObs.title: Download OBS Studio
downloadObs.description: OBS Studio is a free and open-source software for video recording and live streaming. Download it from the official site.

copyKeys.title: Generate Server URL and Stream Key
copyKeys.description: To generate your Server URL and Stream Key, go to the BDLive dashboard, navigate to the 'Stream Keys' section, and click 'Generate Keys'.

step2.title: üéõÔ∏è Step 2: Set Up OBS Studio
step2.description: Now that you have the required data, let‚Äôs set up OBS to work with your stream:

openObs.title: Open OBS Studio
openObs.description: If OBS is not installed yet, download it from the official site and install it. Once launched, the main OBS page will open.

openStreamSettings.title: Open Stream Settings
openStreamSettings.description: In the top menu, click ‚ÄúFile‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúSettings.‚Äù Go to the ‚ÄúStream‚Äù tab.

enterDetails.title: Enter Your Details
enterDetails.description: In the 'Service' field, select 'Custom...'. Paste the previously copied Server URL into the 'URL' field. In the 'Stream Key' field, enter your Stream Key.

saveSettings.title: Save Settings
saveSettings.description: Click 'Apply' and then 'OK' to save the changes.

step3.title: üöÄ Step 3: Start Streaming
step3.description: After successfully setting up OBS, you‚Äôre ready to start a live broadcast:

startStream.title: Start Streaming
startStream.description: Return to the main OBS screen and click the 'Start Streaming' button.

monitorStream.title: Monitor Your Stream
monitorStream.description: Your stream will begin in real-time, and you can monitor it both on the platform and in OBS.

instructionDialog.congrats: ‚ú® Congratulations! You are now ready to share your content with the world through OBS! üéâ
